0.Pros: Gained valuable experience for future internships and employment. Learned skills necessary to succeed in the business world. Hours were flexible, and duties were easy.
0.Cons: Dealing with customer's and inadequate employees was aggravating. Facilities were not always the cleanest.

1.Cons: have to put up with a lot of young coworkers and their problems

2.Pros: As. Great place to learn about the workplace. Great team of employees that I will always love to death
2.Cons: It was hard working in fast food and being on my feet all the time. I would like the chance for a promotion b

3.Pros: Flexible schedule, lots of overtime available, jack of all trades, never get stuck at any station, pretty good pay.
3.Cons: overtime pretty much mandatory, angry customers generally have to deal with you, doing most of the managers job for them.

4.Pros: Depending on the management, McDonalds can be a good starting place. Just by showing up and working, you could easily get promoted to management. The coworkers start to feel like family.
4.Cons: The usual bad customers (and you WILL get those) can ruin your day. It's really repetitive work, and the pay is just above minimum wage. The wrong management will ruin your team.

5.Pros: The pros are the training and management experience that I gained. I gained many valuable skills that I have been able to apply to all aspects of my life.
5.Cons: The only real con that I had was not getting promoted because I was too valuable in my position. Had I gotten the promotion, I would still be working there. Most of the time I wish I still was. I just couldn't wait forever.

6.Pros: Get paid every week, teamwork, great opportunity.
6.Cons: The management sometimes is not good.

7.Pros: Fast-paced environment (which is guess is only a "pro" if you're into that),
7.Cons: Management (in my experience) has no inclination to admit when they're wrong, and quite frankly, doesn't care.

8.Pros: Learning to get along with co-workers and customers
8.Cons: They change your availability without your permission

9.Pros: Love working with public and customer service was my specialty
9.Cons: Serious Upper Management issue. The chain of command from GM was DM the VP and President. But, they wanted to work me 70 hours and pay me for 40 every week. Got old cause I was the GM but never had control of my own restaurant because to many chiefs and not enough indians.
